results.title: Getting started
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and Richard Condie
results.brief_description: In this animated film the hero attempts to practise a piece of music on the piano. A series of distractions delays him and, when he finally sits down to play, pandemonium breaks loose. A short film that will appeal to those of us who tend to procrastinate. (Awards include: Toronto, Zagreb)

results.title: Getting ready to read (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film examines the role that parents can play in helping their children to read. Reading is just one part of literacy so this role begins in the earliest months of a baby’s life. Methods of reading in schools are also examined.

results.title: Getting on the bandwagon
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Gudrun Parker
results.brief_description: To stimulate discussion, questions the basis on which people form their tastes, illustrating the fairly common tendency to go along with the crowd and to stay on the safe side of a difference of opinion. When the parents of her close friend first see the painting of a new artist they consider them odd and unconventional, but after her work is discovered by a socially prominent family they join the chorus of approval. Invites the audiences to comment on the prevalence pf independence or conformity of thought.

results.title: Getting married
results.brief_description: Explores the whole problem of marrying young. Linda and Rodger aged 16 and 20 respectively, discuss their marriage plans with the vicar and their parents. Other couples who have married in their teens, talk about their attitude to sex before marriage and to contraception.
results.description: Explores the whole problem of marrying young. Linda and Rodger aged 16 and 20 respectively, discuss their marriage plans with the vicar and their parents. Other couples who have married in their teens, talk about their attitude to sex before marriage and to contraception.

results.title: Getting it up = Les Valseuses [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Compagnie Artistique de Productions, Paul Claudon and Bertrand Blier
results.brief_description: Jean-Claude (Gerard Depardieu) and Pierrot (Patrick Dewaere) are two ageing delinquents loitering around the Sarcelles housing project. Always ready for an adventure, especially if it involves sex, they attempt a car robbery which leaves Pierrot wounded and forces the pair to flee across the country with Marie-Ange, a frigid hairdresser, as side-kick and scapegoat. From there on ‘Les Valseuses’ becomes a road-movie filled with encounters with a variety of sexually frustrated women whom the infamous trio offers to ‘liberate’. Partly due to the no-hold barred acting style and the shaprness of its one-liners, the film was immediately popular in France. It ‘made’ the carreer of Betrand Blier and coined his reputation as a mysogynist filmmaker. The film also propelled the careers Depardieu, Miou-Miou, Dewaere and Huppert. Even by today’s standard the film has lost none of its shock value. In this odd sexual oddysey Blier captures a raw vision of sex, often ridiculous, thoroughly misapprehended, yet essential. ‘Les Valseuses’ can also be regarded as the precursor of films released in the 1990s exploring every transgressive aspects of human (mostly male) sexuality, such as Neil LaButte’s ‘In the Company of Men’ or Gregg Araki’s ‘The Living End’. For all its jabs at conventional morality, the film also carries a strong sense of class prejudice all too willing at times to portray its working-class protagonists as sexually predatorial bludgers. The film is also known as Going Places (U.S. title), Making It, The Waltzers, but the title best translates as ‘Dangly bits’ or ‘Testicles’. Adapted by Betrand Blier from his novel. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Getting it right: following directions with Goofy (K)
results.brief_description: Donald, Mickey and Goofy demonstrate the importance of instructions and offer suggestions on following written directions and improving your memory. Ideal for encouraging children to ask questions and listen to answers.

results.title: Getting it right
results.creator_credit: FM-TV Australia, Equal Employment Opportunity Trust
results.brief_description: Four scenarios portraying realistic situations in recruitment, counselling, feedback, assessing potential and staff retention. Discusses: job application assumptions, managing subordinates, problems faced by personnel in accepting geographical transfer, ethnicity as a disadvantage in career development, why companies can lose women in management or with management potential.

results.title: Getting it all together
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Malcolm Smith and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Mansfield Park Junior Primary School is the locale for this film which emphasizes the usefulness and value of community involvement in the school. Two dozen mothers tell what it means to them to be part of Mansfield Park. In breaking down the barriers that often still exist between the community and the school, Mansfield Park encourages High School students to visit weekly. There is an exchange of learning. The students are told about the understanding of children between 2 and 5 year and the students in turn help with youngsters with their puzzles and paintings.

results.title: Getting into jeans
results.creator_credit: AVCOM Productions, Ross D Wylie, Chris Strange and Paul Wingate
results.brief_description: Graeme (Shirley) Strachan presents an overview of the production of a pair of jeans from the beginning of the design process through to the sale to the customer. Shows the function of computers in laying out pattern pieces to the material available, the machinist at work, and the activity of wholesalers and retailers.
